intro: Bupleurum longipedicellatum, commonly known as the long-fruited bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing pale blue or white blossoms that attract pollinators. Bupleurum longipedicellatum is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
